cont.entity_a: Suitable for transferring home VHS movies to DVD-R with better quality than the original. Copies from VHS to DVD are better than the VHS original. The unit is easy to program recordings and has good image quality in both 2-hour and 4-hour modes. The unit works fine with various DVD formats but has problems with certain brands. Recording quality is good, but some features fail over time. The on-screen guide is easy to use, and the recording quality is good.
cont.entity_b: TiVo requires signing up for services that charge a monthly fee to access certain shows. The device provides excellent scheduling and viewing flexibility. An 80-hour TiVo records less at higher quality settings. The TiVo unit has issues with wireless connections.

cont.entity_a: Easy to set up and use, with high reliability and ease of use.
cont.entity_b: Setup is easy, but installation is more complex than expected.

cont.entity_a: The machine is prone to freezing and requires unplugging to reset. The Panasonic model was reliable initially but developed various issues over time.
cont.entity_b: This model is no longer supported by TiVo.

cont.entity_a: The machine lacks features like zoom, TV Guide, and cable box control.

Customer Support.comm: Tech support has long hold times and unhelpful personnel.

Connections.comm: The unit lacks HDMI or component hookups.

cont.entity_a: Remote control problems, including missing remote and unresponsive controls.
cont.entity_b: The product lacks necessary components like a remote control in some cases. The product is user-friendly with an intuitive system and remote.
There are compatibility issues with Dish Network.
